title: NetEffectContribution: Remission of diabetes for Example for GIN 2022

relatedArtifact.citation: NetEffectContribution: Remission of diabetes for Example for GIN 2022 [Database Entry: FHIR Evidence Resource]. Contributors: Brian S. Alper [Authors/Creators]. In: Fast Evidence Interoperability Resources (FEvIR) Platform, FOI 179588. Revised 2025-03-05. Available at: https://fevir.net/resources/Evidence/179588. Computable resource at: https://fevir.net/resources/Evidence/179588#json.

resourceReference.display: Outcome Importance Rating (default value 5) of Remission of diabetes

variableDefinition.description: Cohort study with baseline data of exposures from November 2005 through July 2010 and follow-up data from 2006 until death or through December 2015 at a tertiary care outpatient center, Vestfold Hospital Trust, Norway. Consecutive treatment-seeking adult patients (n = 2109) with severe obesity assessed (221 patients excluded and 1888 patients included).

observed.display: StudyGroup: Severely Obese Adults 2018 Norwegian Cohort

variableDefinition.description: comparison groups of bariatric surgery vs. no bariatric surgery

observed.display: GroupAssignment: Bariatric Surgery vs. no bariatric surgery

valueExpression.description: risk difference (relative risk x control event rate) multiplied by relative importance multiplier (defined in OutcomeImportance Profile) -- expression is pseudocode to demonstrate the concept
valueExpression.name: Net effect contribution analysis

name: NetEffectContribution_Remission_of_diabetes_for_Example_for_GIN_2022
